alert.note: Alert for Coal; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 7:03AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Coal and southeastern Pontotoc Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 703 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stonewall, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stonewall, Tupelo, Centrahoma and Jesse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
